# Basic Instructions
For this exercise, I wanted to learn how to create a simple package. I followed the instructions on [this site](https://web.mit.edu/insong/www/pdf/rpackage_instructions.pdf)

<br>

First, we cleared the default directory:
```{r}
rm(list = ls())

ls()
```
<br>

Next, we wrote a simple code for the functions:
```{r}
myfun <- function(x){x+7}

myfun2 <- function(x){x*7}
```
<br>

Following that, we downloaded the 'devtools' package in order to create packages.
<br>

Next, we created the project by first going to "File", then "New Project", then "New Directory", followed by "R Package". We create that project. 
<br>

For the next steps, we manipulated the .Rd files. We built the package, and now the package should work! Let's give it a shot. 
```{r warning=FALSE}
library(pPractice)

pPractice::myfun(5)

pPractice::myfun2(5)
```
<br> 

Well check that out. Everything works! I just created my first R Package.
<br><br>
